definitions.definition: Precluding debate or expostulation ; not admitting of question or appeal
Absolutely requiring compliance or attendance; brooking no further delay; to proceed whether a party attends or not; final.
examples: As this trial has now been postponed multiple times, there will be an adjournment to April 24, peremptory on the parties.

definitions.definition: Positive in opinion or judgment ; absolutely certain , overconfident , unwilling to hear any debate or argument (especially in a pejorative sense); dogmatic .
Accepting no refusal or disagreement; imperious , dictatorial .

main_definition: ( law ) Precluding debate or expostulation ; not admitting of question or appeal
secondary_definitions: ( law ) (of a date or deadline) Absolutely requiring compliance or attendance; brooking no further delay; to proceed whether a party attends or not; final.
Positive in opinion or judgment ; absolutely certain , overconfident , unwilling to hear any debate or argument (especially in a pejorative sense); dogmatic .
( obsolete ) Firmly determined , resolute ; obstinate , stubborn .
Accepting no refusal or disagreement; imperious , dictatorial .
